title: [Bodo_Rosenhahn,_Reinhard_Klette,_Dimitris_Metaxas]Human Motion
description:
This is the first book which informs about recent progress in biomechanics, computer vision and computer graphics Ã¢â‚¬â€œ all in one volume. Researchers from these areas have contributed to this book to promote the establishment of human motion research as a multi-facetted discipline and to improve the exchange of ideas and concepts between these three areas. The book combines carefully written reviews with detailed reports on recent progress in research.

Publisher: Springer; 2008 edition (October 7, 2007)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 1402066929
ISBN-13: 978-1402066924


Biography
Dr. Reinhard Klette, Fellow of the Royal Society of New Zealand, is a Professor at the University of Auckland. His numerous other publications include the books "Euclidean Shortest Paths" (co-authored by Fajie Li), "Panoramic Imaging" (co-authored by Fay Huang and Karsten Scheibe), "Digital Geometry" (co-authored by the late Azriel Rosenfeld), "Computer Vision - Three-Dimensional Data from Images" (co-authored by Karsten Schluens and Andreas Koschan), and "The Handbook of Image Processing Operators" (co-authored by the late Piero Zamperoni)
